sn11.16:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
sn11.16:4.2: And then Sakka, the Lord of Gods, went up to the Buddha,
sn11.16:5.3: making merit that results in attachments,
sn11.16:5.4: where is a gift very fruitful?”
sn11.16:6.2: and four established in the fruit.
sn11.16:7.3: making merit that results in attachments,
sn11.16:7.4: what is given to the Saṅgha is very fruitful.”
